question.title: Problem connecting to a mySql database in a java project
question.body:
I'm encountering an issue while attempting to connect to my database created on HeidiSQL. Specifically, I'm receiving the following error message:

java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mydbname.

Below, I've included the section of code causing the error and my Gradle file, which I use to manage dependencies.

package utilities;

import java.sql.Connection;
import java.sql.DriverManager;
import java.sql.SQLException;

public class DBConnectionUtil {
    // Imposta i dettagli della connessione al tuo database
    private static final String URL = "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mydbname";
    private static final String USERNAME = "myUsername";
    private static final String PASSWORD = "myPassword";
    private static final String DRIVER = "org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver";

    // Metodo statico per ottenere una nuova connessione al database
    public static Connection getConnection() throws SQLException {
        try {
            Class.forName(DRIVER);
        } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return DriverManager.getConnection(URL, USERNAME, PASSWORD);
    }
}

build.gradle.kts

/*
 * This file was generated by the Gradle 'init' task.
 *
 * This generated file contains a sample Java application project to get you started.
 * For more details on building Java & JVM projects,
 * please refer to https://docs.gradle.org/8.6/userguide/building_java_projects.html in the Gradle documentation.
 */

plugins {
    application
    java
    id("com.github.johnrengelman.shadow") version "8.1.1"
    id("java-library")
}


repositories {
    // Use Maven Central for resolving dependencies.
    mavenCentral()
}

dependencies {
    implementation("org.mariadb.jdbc:mariadb-java-client:3.3.3")
    implementation ("com.github.lgooddatepicker:LGoodDatePicker:11.2.1")
    testImplementation(libs.junit.jupiter)
    testRuntimeOnly("org.junit.platform:junit-platform-launcher")
}

// Apply a specific Java toolchain to ease working on different environments.
java {
    toolchain {
        languageVersion = JavaLanguageVersion.of(17)
    }
}

application {
    // Define the main class for the application.
    mainClass = "myLauncher"
}

tasks.named<Test>("test") {
    // Use JUnit Platform for unit tests.
    useJUnitPlatform()
}

I've searched online for potential solutions and found suggestions such as including Class.forName(org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver). However, not only is this no longer necessary, but it also triggers the error java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver.

I've also considered the possibility that Gradle might not be including the libraries correctly. However, the other libraries I'm using are functioning properly, so that doesn't seem to be the issue either. Also, when I run the build in the terminal, there are no errors indicating that the library couldn't be found on Maven.

Could you please review the provided information and suggest any necessary corrections or solutions?

Thank you.
